data.text: @JC7U Not going to entertain you any further. You're nothing but an arrogant bigot whose ignorant of what a bespoke garment is.
@JC7U So let's see you in your suits which probably don't exist.

@JC7U Let's see pictures of you. You're mouthing off so if you're so all that let's see what you've got. A grammar snob as well. What a suprise. Cary Grant btw learnt from other's how to dress. Unlike you he had decency & manners.

@JC7U You obviously no nothing of bespoke tailoring. You're ignorant & argumentative for no reason at all. You dislike Connery who is such a terrible actor he launched a £ billion franchise & won an Oscar.

@JC7U So bloody what. He was the director of a new franchise! Of course he guided him. What point is that you're trying to make? That you dislike Connery & that you're an insufferable snob? Let's see some pictures of you! Let's see how you dress.

@JC7U His background is immaterial. It's what he became that matters. He was cast because he "had it". Cary Grant had a terrible deprived childhood, started as a circus performer. He did ok too. You're a terrible snob. If I judged my prospective customers like you I'd have no business

@JC7U @BondSuits Connery a brute? Are you feeling quite ok? Connery had the height, build & effortless gait to make the clothes he wore look amazing. His first scene in Dr. No wearing THAT shawl collar dj is one of the most memorable in cinematic history.
@JC7U Please read the article to better understand the point that I'm making with that statement. it's not as simple as one sentence.

@JC7U Did you read the article? It's not necessarily about who looked best in suits and was the better tailor. If Roger Moore had set the template for Bond's wardrobe, Bond would have continued to wear double-breasted suits, striped shirts and safari suits after him.
